MemberSignature.Value: public void PopOctetString (System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag? tag = default);
.method public hidebysig instance void PopOctetString(valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> tag) cil managed
Public Sub PopOctetString (Optional tag As Nullable(Of Asn1Tag) = Nothing)
member this.PopOctetString : Nullable<System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> -> unit

Docs.param: The tag to write, or for the default tag (Universal 4).
Docs.summary: Indicate that the open Octet String with the tag UNIVERSAL 4 is closed, returning the writer to the parent context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnEncodingRules.BER> and <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnEncodingRules.DER> modes the encoded contents will remain in a single primitive Octet String. In <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnEncodingRules.CER> mode the contents will be broken up into multiple segments, when required.

Docs.exception: . is , but . is not correct for the method.
the writer is not currently positioned within an Octet String with the specified tag.

Docs.summary: Indicate that the open Set-Of with the specified tag is closed, returning the writer to the parent context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnEncodingRules.CER> and <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnEncodingRules.DER> modes the writer will sort the Set-Of elements when the tag is closed.

Docs.exception: . is , but . is not correct for the method.
the writer is not currently positioned within a Set-Of with the specified tag.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Formats.Asn1.AsnWriter.Scope PushOctetString (System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag? tag = default);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Formats.Asn1.AsnWriter/Scope PushOctetString(valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> tag) cil managed
Public Function PushOctetString (Optional tag As Nullable(Of Asn1Tag) = Nothing) As AsnWriter.Scope
member this.PushOctetString : Nullable<System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> -> System.Formats.Asn1.AsnWriter.Scope

Docs.param: The tag to write, or for the default tag (Universal 4).
Docs.summary: Begin writing an Octet String value with a specified tag.
Docs.returns: A disposable value which will automatically call .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method is just an accelerator for writing an Octet String value where the contents are also ASN.1 data encoded under the same encoding system. When <xref:System.Formats.Asn1.AsnWriter.PopOctetString(System.Nullable{System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag})> is called the entire nested contents are normalized as a single Octet String value, encoded correctly for the current encoding rules. This method does not necessarily create a Constructed encoding, and it is not invalid to write values other than Octet String inside this Push/Pop.

member this.WriteEncodedValue : ReadOnlySpan<byte> -> unit

Docs.param: The value to write.
Docs.summary: Write a single value which has already been encoded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method only checks that the tag and length are encoded according to the current ruleset, and that the end of the value is the end of the input. The contents are not evaluated for semantic meaning.

Docs.exception: could not be read under the current encoding rules. -or- has data beyond the end of the first value.

MemberSignature.Value: public void WriteNamedBitList (System.Collections.BitArray value, System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag? tag = default);
.method public hidebysig instance void WriteNamedBitList(class System.Collections.BitArray value, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> tag) cil managed

member this.WriteNamedBitList : System.Collections.BitArray * Nullable<System.Formats.Asn1.Asn1Tag> -> unit

Docs.param: The bits to write
The tag to write, or for the default tag (Universal 3).
Docs.summary: Write a bit array value as a NamedBitList with a specified tag.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The index of the bit array corresponds to the bit number in the encoded format, which is different than the value produced by <xref:System.Collections.BitArray.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)> with a byte array. For example, the bit array `{ false, true, true }` encodes as `0b0110_0000` with 5 unused bits.

Docs.exception: . is , but . is not correct for the method.
is .
